column2:
Turkey at a Crossroads Erdoğan Faces a Real Risk of Losing Election

Recep Tayyip Erdoğan has ruled Turkey for over 20 years. Now, there is a real chance he could be defeated in Sunday's election. A journey to disappointed supporters, companies suffering under the beleaguered economy – and to the man who could oust the eternal president. By Şebnem Arsu, Maximilian Popp und Özlem Topçu
9. Mai 2023, 10.59 Uhr • 26 Min
column3: Erdoğan Faces a Real Risk of Losing Election
column5: Recep Tayyip Erdoğan has ruled Turkey for over 20 years. Now, there is a real chance he could be defeated in Sunday's election. A journey to disappointed supporters, companies suffering under the beleaguered economy – and to the man who could oust the eternal president.

column2:
Moscow Mole The Story Behind Germany's Embarrassing Intelligence Leak

From the shores of a lake near Munich to a brothel in the German capital city and a brasserie in Moscow: It is one of the biggest intelligence scandals in Germany's postwar history. How was Russia able to pilfer information about Ukraine from Berlin's most accomplished spy organization?
10. März 2023, 18.06 Uhr • 22 Min
column3: The Story Behind Germany's Embarrassing Intelligence Leak
column5: From the shores of a lake near Munich to a brothel in the German capital city and a brasserie in Moscow: It is one of the biggest intelligence scandals in Germany's postwar history. How was Russia able to pilfer information about Ukraine from Berlin's most accomplished spy organization?
